title: reference request - Well-posedness of gradient flows
body: For a convex lower-semicontinuous functional on a Hilbert space $I\colon H\rightarrow\mathbb{R}$, it is shown in Evans' PDE that the Hilbert-space-valued ODE $$\begin{cases}\mathbf{u}'(t)\in-\partial I[\mathbf{u}(t)]\\\mathbf{u}(0)=u\in H\end{cases}$$ is well-posed for all time, where $\partial I[\cdot]$ denotes the subdifferential. The intuition makes perfect sense, and I am wondering if there are similar results by relaxing convexity. In particular, is there a well-posedness result if $I$ is say simply bounded from below, or coercive? Intuitively it seems plausible, but I haven't been able to find a nice resource on this matter. Perhaps even a nice text on variational methods might have what I'm looking for? reference-request ap.analysis-of-pdes convex-optimization calculus-of-variations gradient-flows Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited May 18, 2020 at 21:03 leo monsaingeon 5,285 2 2 gold badges 26 26 silver badges 51 51 bronze badges asked Dec 8, 2015 at 21:11 charlestoncrabb 123 6 6 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 1 $\begingroup$ MathSciNet tells me about some papers of Rossi and Savare MR2224826, and MR2148878. Taking a quick look, it seems that one of the things that breaks is uniqueness.
